sentences.en: A succession of bad harvest had reduced the small farmer to penury.
sentences.cn: 连续歉收使得这个小农场主陷入了贫困境地.

sentences.en: a succession of visitors
sentences.cn: 络绎不绝的来访者

sentences.en: He gave forth a series of works in rapid succession.
sentences.cn: 他很快连续发表了一系列的作品.

sentences.en: He hit three bull's eyes in succession.
sentences.cn: 他连续3次射中靶心.

sentences.en: he was elevated to the Lords in succession to his father.
sentences.cn: 他继承父业升为上议院议员。

sentences.en: His succession as headmaster was not in any doubt.
sentences.cn: 他继任校长是确定无疑的.

sentences.en: His words came out in quick succession.
sentences.cn: 他的话连珠炮似地说了出来.

sentences.en: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.cn: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

sentences.en: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
sentences.cn: 人们通过不断犯错误接近不可企及的真理。

sentences.en: Reports of success on all fronts came in quick succession.
sentences.cn: 全国各条战线纷纷报喜.

sentences.en: Reports of victory came in quick succession.
sentences.cn: 捷报频传.

sentences.en: Several courses were served in succession.
sentences.cn: 一连上了好几道菜.

sentences.en: She won the championship four times in succession.
sentences.cn: 她连续四次夺得冠军。

sentences.en: she won the race for the second year in succession.
sentences.cn: 她连续赢得了第二年的赛跑冠军。

sentences.en: The endless succession of parties wore us out.
sentences.cn: 接连不断的聚会把我们累垮了.

sentences.en: the queen’s succession to the throne
sentences.cn: 女王对王位的继承

sentences.en: The teacher explained twice in succession.
sentences.cn: 教师连着讲了两遍.

sentences.en: There was a dispute about the rightful succession to the throne.
sentences.cn: 对于王位的合法继承权有过一场争论.

sentences.en: They asked their questions in rapid succession.
sentences.cn: 他们连珠炮似地提出了一系列问题.

sentences.en: Yesterday's emphatic victory was their fifth in succession.
sentences.cn: 昨天的大胜是他们连续第5场胜利。

words.tran_cn: 连续的；继承的；依次的；接替的

phrases.tran_cn: 继承…的（地)，接任…的（地)，当选…的（地）
次级演替；次生演替系列
决定谁是接替者（或继承人）

trans.tran_cn: 继承人，继承权，继承顺序，[生]自然演替，一系列，接连
trans.tran_en: happening one after the other without anything diffe-rent happening in between
